raw.description: Identifier for hydrological basins as defined by the HydroBASINS framework
raw.name: HYBAS_ID

raw.description: The longitude for specific geographic locations used to map the presence/absence of species.
raw.name: long

raw.description: The latitude for specific geographic locations used to map the presence/absence of species.
raw.name: lat

raw.description: This variable represents the average speciation rates of species within each sub-basin, as estimated by BAMM
raw.name: BAMM_speciation

raw.description: This variable represents the mean extinction rates for each tip of the phylogenetic tree, as estimated by the BAMM analysis
raw.name: BAMM_extinction

raw.description:
This variable stands for the net diversification rates, which are calculated by subtracting the mean extinction rates from the mean 
speciation rates for each tip in the phylogenetic tree.
raw.name: BAMM_NetDiv

raw.description: Diversification Rate, a transformed measure of evolutionary distinctness to understand phylogenetic diversity. The lower the "ed" value, the higher the "DR" metric, indicating a species with less unique evolutionary history compared to others in the phylogeny.
raw.name: DR

raw.description: Rates of Body Elongation evolution
raw.name: BEL_evol

raw.description: Rates of Maximum Body Length evolution
raw.name: MBL_evol

raw.description: Rates of Oral Gape Position Evolution
raw.name: OGP_evol

raw.description: Rates of Relative Eye Size Evolution
raw.name: RES_evol

raw.description: Rate of Relative Maxillary Length evolution
raw.name: RML_evol

raw.description: This variable represents the annual mean temperature.
raw.name: bio1

raw.description: This variable represents the annual mean precipitation.
raw.name: bio12

raw.description: This variable is used to represent the quantity of water from precipitation that flows over the land's surface and does not get absorbed into the ground. It is being extracted from a geographic database (HydroAtlas).
raw.name: runoff

raw.description: Actual evapotranspiration, which is the sum of evaporation and plant transpiration from the Earth's land and ocean surface to the atmosphere.
raw.name: aet

raw.description: Mean elevation data indicating the height above sea level.
raw.name: Elevation

raw.description:
Stream gradient is a measure of the steepness or incline of a stream or river. It can affect water flow and sediment transport, which in turn can influence the habitat conditions for freshwater species. Higher stream gradients usually correspond to faster-moving 
water and can create different ecological conditions compared to lower gradients.
raw.name: sgr

raw.description: It measures the diversity of soil types or conditions within each sub-basin studied. Soil diversity is computed using a dataset that includes eight variables related to substrate types and soil conditions.
raw.name: soil_div

raw.description: The geographic area of a sub-basin, possibly in square meters, used as one of the predictors in the analysis.
raw.name: area

raw.description: Species diversity, which in ecological studies typically refers to the number of species and their relative abundances in a given area.
raw.name: diversity

datasets.description: This dataset contains the drivers of speciation rates in South American freshwater fishes, employing an integrative approach that considers multiple biotic and abiotic factors.
datasets.name: body-size-evolution-in-south-american-freshwater-fishes.csv

queries.question: What entities show a weak but significant, positive relationship with a coefficient of 0.00003018?
What type of relationship exists between speciation rates and species diversity?
